introductions.name: Xie Ruolan
introductions.description: Your princess consort, born to the Xie clan of Danling. Through marriage ties, the Xie family is a powerful ally.

introductions.name: Chu Huan
introductions.description: Commander of the capital gates. He escorted you south from the north and has earned your deep trust.

introductions.name: Xie Jian'an
introductions.description: Head of the Xie family of Danling and father of Xie Ruolan. He serves as Minister (Shangshu Ling) in the current court.

introductions.name: Yu Gong
introductions.description: President of the Imperial Academy. Haughty and aloof, he commands great respect among scholars.

introductions.name: Chen Wan'er
introductions.description: Born into the leading Chen family of Qingzhou. Her great-uncle is Chancellor Chen Dao, a man of enormous power.

introductions.name: Wang Ming
introductions.description: A student of Yu Gong.

introductions.name: Sikong Zheng
introductions.description: Your elder full brother, who holds the title Prince Ning.

introductions.name: Cao Biaozhi
introductions.description: Deputy Minister of Revenue and one of Xuan state's rare pragmatists. Upright, efficient, and a former pupil of Chen Lang, ancestor of the Chen house.

introductions.name: Chen Dao
introductions.description: Head of the Chen household and serving Chancellor — the foremost leader among Xuan's aristocratic clans.

introductions.name: Empress Li
introductions.description: The biological mother of you and Sikong Zheng.

introductions.name: Chen Ying
introductions.description: Son of Chen Dao.

introductions.name: Xie Xuan
introductions.description: Youngest son of Xie Jian'an and younger brother of Xie Ruolan.

introductions.name: Zu Kun
introductions.description: A highly respected general in the Xuan army.

introductions.name: Zu Kun
introductions.description: A highly respected general in the Xuan army.

introductions.name: Zu Kun
introductions.description: A highly respected general in the Xuan army.

introductions.name: Xie Xuan
introductions.description: A Zhonglang general serving in the Northern forces.

introductions.name: Zhu Yuanzhi
introductions.description: Commander charged with pacifying the border bandits.

introductions.name: Shi Lang
introductions.description: Left General of the Wunu (Zhao) army.

introductions.name: Shi Lang
introductions.description: Left General of the Wunu (Zhao) army.

introductions.name: Shi Lang
introductions.description: Left General of the Wunu (Zhao) army.

introductions.name: Shi Lang
introductions.description: Left General of the Wunu (Zhao) army.

introductions.name: Shi Lang
introductions.description: Left General of the Wunu (Zhao) army.

introductions.name: Warning
introductions.description: Extensive interaction is required ahead — prepare accordingly.

introductions.name: Chen Lang
introductions.description: Forebear of the Chen house and a veteran minister across three reigns; served as Minister of Personnel during the Jianping era.

introductions.name: Fan Zhong
introductions.description: The adopted son (godson) of Wenxian.

introductions.name: Sikong Xu
introductions.description: Your second prince, born to Consort Chen Wan'er.

introductions.name: Sikong Sheng
introductions.description: The Crown Prince — your eldest son, born to the late Empress Xie Ruolan.

introductions.name: Sikong Yu
introductions.description: Bestowed the title Princess of Xunyang — your youngest daughter, born to Consort Liu Nian (Zhaoyi).

introductions.name: Fan Zhong
introductions.description: Chief palace eunuch, successor to Eunuch Wen — now your close personal attendant.

introductions.name: Chu Meng
introductions.description: Son of Chu Huan and a Colonel of the Imperial Guards. When his family was implicated, you secretly sheltered him; after his vindication he became your personal guard.

introductions.name: Li Dingyuan
introductions.description: Former commander of the imperial city garrison. A former ally of Prince Ning — you retained him to keep watch over the court officials.

introductions.name: Murong Cui
introductions.description: Envoy from Yan East and one of the youngest, most promising commanders from that region.

introductions.name: Qiu Sheng
introductions.description: Count of Yun County and a veteran soldier once under Liu Dadao. He distinguished himself in the bloody fighting at Yiyang.
